rComments: The lecture summaries and tutorials are a lot more helpful than the lectures. The lectures are very confusing and he has a tendency to babble. I zoned out 90% of the time. The textbook was not required.

Guillaume is a fair person who doesn't trick you (say X then put Y on the exam). He's really accommodating in lecture and office hours but tends to go off tangent and make things more complex than necessary. His grading scheme is pretty stiff (only 2 mediums + final exam). But stick around, he's a nice guy and quite self-aware. He tries to help you

Guillaume was great, he was very generous with grading our papers and did not mind giving us extensions and was super lenient. This was a filed course and Guillaume was very considerate and informed of the struggles we went through and that understanding reflected in his grading too. He was generous with deadlines and grades

Basically, if you're anything like me and semantics does NOT come easily to you, it's not so bad! Prof Thomas has been so supportive to me this semester, including going over the entire midterm step by step with me to make sure I understood everything, and offering to meet me outside of class and office hours when I had questions about homework.

I think if you had Guillaume in LIN232 you would have had a bad impression of him because he was not prepared to teach then. But for LIN241, he has provided lots of great slides, lecture summaries, and review questions with answers. It's clear that perhaps he was uncomfortable teaching LIN232 but definitely took things seriously for this course.
teacherRatingTags: ['Accessible outside class', 'Hilarious', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Seeing all the negative reviews for Prof Thomas is surprising to me, as I had an excellent experience in his class. He is very helpful in office hours, and his lectures reinforce the information in the textbook. He does have an accent, but certainly not enough to impede my learning. If you work hard, Prof Thomas's class is very rewarding
teacherRatingTags: ['Accessible outside class', 'Gives good feedback', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Not a very good lecturer, does not speak with enough energy and sounds boring most of the time. Bad lecture structures, no PowerPoint slides, lectures notes posted online are even longer and more confusing than the actual lectures. Can skip his class as long as you read the textbook.

Definitely the worst professor I've had at UofT thus far. Firstly he doesn't have any structure to lectures, no slides to help us, no worksheets to bring during lecture, secondly he has a very thick accent which make is difficult to understand anything he says, thirdly he needs to stop saying "um" bc that's all I notice. Avoid him like the plague.
